intro: Eriocaulon maharashtrense, commonly known as the Maharashtra sedge, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of southern Asia, particularly India. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
